title: Dry Tortugas National Park: Videos
body: Videos       All National Park Service video is copyright free and available for public use.          NPS Photo by Jennifer Brown   Plan Your Visit: Dry Tortugas National Park  Dry Tortugas National Park is a remote park about 70 miles west of Key West, Florida that includes historic Fort Jefferson and surrounding coral reefs. This video introduces visitors to fundamental trip planning to get to and enjoy this amazing place.          NPS PHOTO BY JENNIFER BROWN  Fort Jefferson Stabilization ProjectLearn about an important preservation project to stabilize Fort Jefferson in Dry Tortugas National Park. This project is funded by the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (ARRA).           Dry Tortugas Research Natural AreaView the underwater beauty found in the shallow waters of Dry Tortugas National Park. This video will help you understand the marine resources this park protects for future generations.            Waterways VideosThese videos explore the natural and cultural heritage of south Florida's Florida Bay.
